identified-content.person: Rubin, Dr. Talia B. (Dr. Talia B. Langman)

block.p: Dr. Talia B. Rubin, a daughter of Evelyn C. Rubin-Houpt of Englewood, N.J., and Ronald I. Rubin of Riverdale, the Bronx, is to be married this afternoon to Dr. Yaron D. Langman, the son of Roberta Langman and Samuel Langman of Freehold, N.J. Rabbi Shmuel Goldin is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Keter Torah in Teaneck, N.J.

The bride, 27, graduated cum laude from Barnard and received a dental degree from Columbia last month. She is to start a general practice residency at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell hospital next month.

Dr. Talia B. Rubin, a daughter of Evelyn C. Rubin-Houpt of Englewood, N.J., and Ronald I. Rubin of Riverdale, the Bronx, is to be married this afternoon to Dr. Yaron D. Langman, the son of Roberta Langman and Samuel Langman of Freehold, N.J. Rabbi Shmuel Goldin is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Keter Torah in Teaneck, N.J.

Dr. Talia B. Rubin, a daughter of Evelyn C. Rubin-Houpt of Englewood, N.J., and Ronald I. Rubin of Riverdale, the Bronx, is to be married this afternoon to Dr. Yaron D. Langman, the son of Roberta Langman and Samuel Langman of Freehold, N.J. Rabbi Shmuel Goldin is to perform the ceremony at Congregation Keter Torah in Teaneck, N.J.

The bride, 27, graduated cum laude from Barnard and received a dental degree from Columbia last month. She is to start a general practice residency at NewYork-Presbyterian/Weill Cornell hospital next month.

Her father is a professor of political science at the Borough of Manhattan Community College. Her mother is a child psychologist with a private practice in Riverdale and Englewood. The bride is a stepdaughter of Miriam Rothenberg-Rubin and Dr. Milton I. Houpt.

The bridegroom, 29, is a chief resident of internal medicine at Montefiore Medical Center in the Bronx, where he will begin a fellowship in gastroenterology in July. He graduated with high honors from Rutgers and received his medical degree from the Albert Einstein College of Medicine.

His mother teaches computer skills and art at the Carl W. Goetz Middle School and computer skills at the Elms Elementary School, both in Jackson, N.J. His father retired as an appliance technician working out of Lakewood, N.J., for Sears.
